page.title: 03VERGE AND HEDGEROW
page.content: THE ROAD IS APPROXIMATELY 2.5 METRES FLANKED BY HEDGES AND SHALLOW DITCHES. IN AN HOUR AND A HALF SIX VEHICLES AND ONE ELDERLY COUPLE, WALKING, PASS BY. FROM THE DISTANCE CAN BE HEARD THE DRONE OF TRAFFIC, A TRACTOR AT WORK AND AN AEROPLANE. THE VERGES OF THE LANE ARE GENERALLY UNCULTIVATED, ABOUT HALF A METRE WIDE AND CONTAIN A VARIETY OF PLANTS, NAMELY VARIOUS GRASSES, COW PARSLEY, COMFREY, CUCKOO FLOWER, PRIMROSE, VIOLET, DAISY,HERB ROBERT, OX-EYE DAISY, GOOSEGRASS, LORDS AND LADIES, MOSSES, CREEPING BUTTERCUP, BLUEBELL, STITCHWORT,BUGLE, YARROW, SPEEDWELL AND VETCH. ON AND AROUND THE PLANTS ARE THE OCCASIONAL ORANGE TIP, SPECKLED WHITE AND RED ADMIRAL BUTTERFLIES AND OTHER INSECTS. THERE IS EVIDENCE OF RABBITS AND SONGS OF THE SPARROW, SKYLARK, STARLING AND BLACKBIRD CAN BE HEARD.
